arm_group.description: Ibrutinib 560 mg (PO) +lenalidomide at Maximum Tolerated Dose (PO) + DA-EPOCH-R

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a Phase 1b/2, open-label, non-randomized multicenter study to assess the safety and
      efficacy of ibrutinib and lenalidomide in combination with DA-EPOCH-R in subjects with
      relapsed/refractory Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma (DLBCL).  This study is conducted in 2
      parts where treatment will be administered in 3-week (21-day) cycles for 6 cycles.  A
      standard 3+3 design will be employed in Part 1 to determine the maximum tolerated dose
      (MTD), which will then define the dose to be used in Part 2.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ibrutinib and Lenalidomide With Dose Adjusted EPOCH-R in Subjects With Relapsed/Refractory Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma
condition: Diffuse Large B Cell Lymphoma Relapsed
Diffuse Large B Cell Lymphoma Refractory

criteria.textblock:
Major inclusion criteria:

          -  Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of ≤2

          -  Pathologically confirmed relapsed/refractory DLBCL

          -  Subjects must have ≥1 measurable disease site on CT scan (≥ 1.5 cm in longest
             dimension).

          -  Adequate hepatic and renal function:

               -  AST or ALT ≤2.5 x ULN

               -  Serum Creatinine ≤ 2.0 mg/dL or creatinine clearance ≥60 mL/min/1.73

               -  Bilirubin ≤1.5 x ULN

          -  Adequate hematologic function:

               -  ANC >1,000 cells/mm3

               -  Platelets ≥75,000 cells/mm3

               -  Hemoglobin ≥8.0 g/dL

               -  Prothrombin time (PT) and activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT) must be
                  ≤1.5 x the upper limit of the normal range (ULN)

          -  Must be registered into the Revlimid REMS™program and be willing to comply with the
             requirements of Revlimid REMS™.

        Major Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Known central nervous system lymphoma

          -  Any chemotherapy, external beam radiation therapy, or anti-cancer antibodies within 2
             weeks

          -  Radio- or toxin-immunoconjugates within 10 weeks

          -  Prior allogenetic stem cell (or other organ) transplant within 6 months or any
             evidence of active graft-versus-host disease or requirement for immunosuppressants
             within 28 days prior to first dose of study drug

intervention.other_name: Etoposide, Prednisone, Doxorubicin, Cyclophsosphamide, Vincristine, Rituximab, Pegfilgrastim
Etoposide, Prednisone, Doxorubicin, Cyclophsosphamide, Vincristine, Rituximab, Pegfilgrastim

clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Study of Ibrutinib and Lenalidomide in Combination With DA-EPOCH-R in Subjects With Relapsed or Refractory Diffuse Large B-cell Lymphoma

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Part-1: To determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of the combination of ibrutinib and lenalidomide with dose adjusted EPOCH-R
primary_outcome.measure: Number of Dose-Limiting Toxicities as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year from first patient's first  dose

primary_outcome.description: Part 2 - Overall Response rate will be defined as the proportion of subjects who achieve either a CR or a PR according to the international Working Group  Response Criteria for NHL as assessed by investigator.
primary_outcome.measure: Number of Complete Responses (CR) and Partial Responses (PR) as a Measure of Efficacy
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after last patient's first dose

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Part-1: Overall Response rate (ORR) will defined as the proportion of subjects who achieve either a CR or a PR according to the international Working Group  Response Criteria for NHL as assessed by investigator.
secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Complete Responses (CR) and Partial Responses (PR) as a Measure of Efficacy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after first patient's first dose

secondary_outcome.description: Part 2: The frequency (number and percentage) of treatment-emergent adverse events will be reported.
secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients with Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after last patient's first dose

secondary_outcome.description:
Part 2:  DOR will be measured from the time by which the measurement criteria are met for CR or PR until the first date by which recurrent or progressive disease is objectively documented.
PFS will be measured as time from first study drug administration to disease progression or death from any cause.
OS will be measured from the time of first study drug administration until the date of death using Kaplan-Meier methodology.
secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Response (DOR), Progression Free Survival (PRF) and Overall Survival (OS) as a Measure of Efficacy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after firs patient's last dose

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
